Description: Granulated goldwork fragment of a fitting, possibly an ear-ring, entirely made of globules welded together, in form of a cylindrical openwork on a disc made of smaller globules, on the edge of which are fixed, like for a two-handled basket, two circular and slightly curved loops (one partly missing).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the denuded surface of the site or the neighbourhood ?
Curator's comments: One of the gold "pieces of globule work, probably of earrings" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, "Gold earring, open work of soldered globules", p. 110, pl. xli, 12.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 12)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.83, p.186, pl.28)
